clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of XP12B in Women With Menorrhagia
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Group, Multicenter Study To Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of XP12B for the Treatment of Menorrhagia

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether XP12B is effective and safe in the treatment of women with heavy menstrual bleeding associated with menorrhagia.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Reduction From Baseline in Menstrual Blood Loss (MBL)
primary_outcome.description: reduction of menstrual blood loss in mL

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Reported Outcome Measure of Limitations in Social or Leisure Activities Associated With Heavy Menstrual Bleeding
secondary_outcome.description: A positive unit change of the mean relects an improvement from baseline. Patient reported outcome scores had the following response categories: 1=not limited at all; 2=slightly limited; 3=moderately limited; 4=quite a bit limited; and 5=extremely limited

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Reported Outome Measure of Limitations in Physical Activities Associated With Heavy Menstrual Bleeding
secondary_outcome.description: A positive unit change of the mean relects an improvement from baseline. Patient reported outcome scores had the following response categories: 1=not limited at all; 2=slightly limited; 3=moderately limited; 4=quite a bit limited; and 5=extremely limited

secondary_outcome.measure: Responder Analysis - Reduction in Large Stains
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects who experienced a reduction from baseline in the frequency of large stains

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women with menorrhagia
- 18-49 years of age
- Regularly occurring menstrual periods
Exclusion Criteria:
- History or presence of clinically significant disease or abnormalities that may confound the study
- History of bilateral oophorectomy or hysterectomy
- Hormone therapy for birth control
